text.section: A board of appeals consists of at least three members.
A member of a board of appeals shall be appointed by the local executive and confirmed by the legislative body.
The term of office of a member of a board of appeals is 3 years.

A member of a board of appeals may be removed:
for cause;
on written charges; and
after a public hearing.
The appointing authority shall appoint a new member to fill the unexpired term of any member who leaves a board of appeals.

section.section: A legislative body shall designate one alternate member for the board of appeals who may sit on the board when another member of the board is absent or recused.
When the alternate member is absent or recused, the legislative body may designate a temporary alternate.
